Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for iloperidone and CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312201
Text: "Dosage adjustment for patients taking FANAPT [iloperidone] who are poor metabolizers of CYP2D6: FANAPT [iloperidone] dose should be reduced by one-half for poor metabolizers of CYP2D6."

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for irinotecan and UGT1A1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312562
Text:
The CAMPTOSAR [irinotecan] label states "Individuals who are homozygous for the UGT1A1*28 allele (UGT1A1 7/7 genotype) are at increased risk for neutropenia following initiation of CAMPTOSAR [irinotecan] treatment...When administered in combination with other agents or as a single-agent, a reduction in the starting dose by at least one level of CAMPTOSAR should be considered for patients known to be homozygous for the UGT1A1*28 allele. However, the precise dose reduction in this patient population is not known and subsequent dose modifications should be considered based on individual patient tolerance to treatment."
The ONIVYDE [irinotecan] label states "The recommended starting dose of ONIVYDE in patients known to be homozygous for the UGT1A1*28 allele is 50 mg/m2 administered by intravenous infusion over 90 minutes. Increase the dose of ONIVYDE to 70 mg/m2 as tolerated in subsequent cycles."
See labels for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for irinotecan and UGT1A1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166339781
Text:
The CAMPTOSAR [irinotecan] label states "Individuals who are homozygous for the UGT1A1*28 allele (UGT1A1 7/7 genotype) are at increased risk for neutropenia following initiation of CAMPTOSAR [irinotecan] treatment...When administered in combination with other agents or as a single-agent, a reduction in the starting dose by at least one level of CAMPTOSAR should be considered for patients known to be homozygous for the UGT1A1*28 allele. However, the precise dose reduction in this patient population is not known and subsequent dose modifications should be considered based on individual patient tolerance to treatment."
The ONIVYDE [irinotecan] label states "The recommended starting dose of ONIVYDE in patients known to be homozygous for the UGT1A1*28 allele is 50 mg/m2 administered by intravenous infusion over 90 minutes. Increase the dose of ONIVYDE to 70 mg/m2 as tolerated in subsequent cycles."
See labels for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for irinotecan and UGT1A1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166339401
Text: The CAMPTOSAR (irinotecan) label states: "When administered in combination with other agents, or as a single-agent, consider a reduction in the starting dose by at least one level of CAMPTOSAR for patients known to be homozygous for the UGT1A1*28 or *6 alleles (*28/*28, *6/*6) or compound heterozygous for the UGT1A1*28 and *6 alleles (*6/*28)... Subsequent dosage modifications may be required based on individual patient tolerance to treatment" See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for irinotecan and UGT1A1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166339421
Text: The CAMPTOSAR (irinotecan) label states: "When administered in combination with other agents, or as a single-agent, consider a reduction in the starting dose by at least one level of CAMPTOSAR for patients known to be homozygous for the UGT1A1*28 or *6 alleles (*28/*28, *6/*6) or compound heterozygous for the UGT1A1*28 and *6 alleles (*6/*28)... Subsequent dosage modifications may be required based on individual patient tolerance to treatment" See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for irinotecan and UGT1A1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166340422
Text: The CAMPTOSAR [irinotecan] label states "Individuals who are heterozygous for either the UGT1A1*28 or *6 alleles (*1/*6, *1/*28) are UGT1A1 intermediate metabolizers and may also have an increased risk of severe or life-threatening neutropenia. Published studies have shown that individuals with UGT1A1*28 and *6 alleles may be at an increased risk of severe diarrhea." "Closely monitor patients with UGT1A1*28 or *6 alleles for neutropenia during and after treatment with CAMPTOSAR." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for irinotecan and UGT1A1

Published studies have shown that individuals with UGT1A1*28 and *6 alleles may be at an increased risk of severe diarrhea." "Closely monitor patients with UGT1A1*28 or *6 alleles for neutropenia during and after treatment with CAMPTOSAR." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for isoflurane and CACNA1S, RYR1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312623
Text: "CONTRAINDICATIONS...with known or suspected genetic susceptibility to malignant hyperthermia...FORANE [isoflurane] can induce malignant hyperthermia in patients with known or suspected susceptibility based on genetic factors or family history, including those with certain inherited ryanodine receptor (RYR1) or dihydropyridine receptor (CACNA1S) variants." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for ivacaftor and CFTR
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311821
Text: "KALYDECO [ivacaftor] is a cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) potentiator indicated for the treatment of cystic fibrosis (CF) in patients age 12 months or older who have one mutation in the CFTR gene that is responsive to ivacaftor based on clinical and/or in vitro assay data." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for lesinurad and CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311982
Text: "ZURAMPIC [lesinurad] should be used with caution in patients taking moderate inhibitors of CYP2C9 (eg, fluconazole, amiodarone), and in CYP2C9 poor metabolizers." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for lesinurad and CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311981

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for lidocaine and tetracaine and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312426
Text: "Although all patients are at risk for methemoglobinemia, patients with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency, ... are more susceptible to developing clinical manifestations of the condition. If local anesthetics must be used in these patients, close monitoring for symptoms and signs of methemoglobinemia is recommended." See label for more information.

Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166309401

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for meclizine and CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166309563
Text: "... when ANTIVERT® [meclizine] is administered to patients with CYP2D6 polymorphism, monitor for adverse reactions and clinical effect accordingly." See label for more information.
Implications: "The genetic polymorphism of CYP2D6 that results in poor-, intermediate-, extensive-, and ultrarapid metabolizer phenotypes could contribute to large inter-individual variability in meclizine exposure."

Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166309541
Text: "... when ANTIVERT® [meclizine] is administered to patients with CYP2D6 polymorphism, monitor for adverse reactions and clinical effect accordingly." See label for more information.
Implications: "The genetic polymorphism of CYP2D6 that results in poor-, intermediate-, extensive-, and ultrarapid metabolizer phenotypes could contribute to large inter-individual variability in meclizine exposure."

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for meloxicam and CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312029
Text: "In patients who are known or suspected to be poor CYP2C9 metabolizers based on genotype or previous history/experience with other CYP2C9 substrates (such as warfarin or phenytoin), consider dose reduction, as these patients may have abnormally high plasma levels of meloxicam due to reduced metabolic clearance. Monitor these patients for adverse effects." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for meloxicam and CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312030
Text: "In patients who are known or suspected to be poor CYP2C9 metabolizers based on genotype or previous history/experience with other CYP2C9 substrates (such as warfarin or phenytoin), consider dose reduction, as these patients may have abnormally high plasma levels of meloxicam due to reduced metabolic clearance. Monitor these patients for adverse effects." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for mepivacaine and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166315144
Text: "Although all patients are at risk for methemoglobinemia, patients with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency, ... are more susceptible to developing clinical manifestations of the condition. If local anesthetics must be used in these patients, close monitoring for symptoms and signs of methemoglobinemia is recommended." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for mercaptopurine and NUDT15, TPMT
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311181
Text: The mercaptopurine (PURIXAN) label states: "Heterozygous Deficiency in TPMT and/or NUDT15 … Reduce the PURIXAN dosage based on tolerability. Most patients with heterozygous TPMT or NUDT15 deficiency tolerate recommended dosage, but some require dose reduction based on adverse reactions. Patients who are heterozygous for both TPMT and NUDT15 may require more substantial dose reductions.” See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for mercaptopurine and NUDT15, TPMT
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311148
Text: The mercaptopurine (PURIXAN) label states: "Homozygous Deficiency in either TPMT or NUDT15 … Patients with homozygous deficiency of either enzyme typically require 10% or less of the recommended dosage. Reduce the recommended starting dosage of PURIXAN in patients who are known to have homozygous TPMT or NUDT15 deficiency." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for methylene blue and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312242
Text: "PROVAYBLUE [methylene blue] is contraindicated for use in patients with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for methylene blue and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312241
Text: "PROVAYBLUE [methylene blue] is contraindicated for use in patients with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for methylene blue and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166314962
Text: "PROVAYBLUE [methylene blue] is contraindicated for use in patients with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for metoclopramide and CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312361
Text: "Reduce the Reglan [metoclopramide] dosage in patients who are poor CYP2D6 metabolizers." Table 1 of the label gives the recommended dosage in patients with gastroesophageal reflux who are CYP2D6 poor metabolizers: "5 mg four times daily (thirty minutes before each meal and at bedtime), or 10 mg taken three times daily" with a maximum recommended daily dosage of 30 mg. Table 2 of the label gives the recommended dosage in patients with acute and recurrent diabetic gastroparesis who are CYP2D6 poor metabolizers: "5 mg four times daily (thirty minutes before each meal and at bedtime)" with a maximum recommended daily dosage of 20 mg. See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for moviprep and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166315002
Text: "Since MoviPrep contains sodium ascorbate and ascorbic acid, MoviPrep should be used with caution in patients with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G-6-PD) deficiency, especially G-6-PD deficiency patients with an active infection, with a history of hemolysis, or taking concomitant medications known to precipitate hemolytic reactions." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for nitrofurantoin and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166345901
Text: The nitrofurantoin (Furadantin) label states: "Cases of hemolytic anemia of the primaquine-sensitivity type have been induced by nitrofurantoin. Hemolysis appears to be linked to a glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency in the red blood cells of the affected patients. [...] Hemolysis is an indication for discontinuing Furadantin; hemolysis ceases when the drug is withdrawn." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for oliceridine and CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312414
Text: "In patients who are known or suspected to be poor CYP2D6 metabolizers, based on genotype or previous history/experience with other CYP2D6 substrates, less frequent dosing of OLINVYK [oliceridine] may be required. These patients should be closely monitored, and subsequent doses should be based on the patient’s severity of pain and response to treatment." See label for more information

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for oxcarbazepine and HLA-B
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166310841
Text: "The use of oxcarbazepine should be avoided in patients positive for HLA-B*1502 unless the benefits clearly outweigh the risks." See label for more information.

Text: "Although all patients are at risk for methemoglobinemia, patients with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency, ... are more susceptible to developing clinical manifestations of the condition. If local anesthetics must be used in these patients, close monitoring for symptoms and signs of methemoglobinemia is recommended." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for phenytoin and CYP2C9, HLA-B
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311452
Text: "Patients who are intermediate or poor metabolizers of CYP2C9 substrates (e.g., *1/*3, *2/*2, *3/*3) may exhibit increased phenytoin serum concentrations compared to patients who are normal metabolizers (e.g., *1/*1). Thus, patients who are known to be intermediate or poor metabolizers may ultimately require lower doses of phenytoin to maintain similar steady-state concentrations compared to normal metabolizers...Consider avoiding DILANTIN [phenytoin] as an alternative to carbamazepine in patients who are positive for HLA-B*1502 or in CYP2C9*3 carriers." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for pimozide and CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166309021
Text: "At doses above 4 mg/day, CYP2D6 genotyping should be performed. In poor CYP2D6 metabolizers, ORAP [pimozide] doses should not exceed 4 mg/day, and doses should not be increased earlier than 14 days." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for pimozide and CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312148
Text: "At doses above 0.05 mg/kg/day, CYP2D6 genotyping should be performed. In poor CYP2D6 metabolizers, ORAP [pimozide] doses should not exceed 0.05 mg/kg/day, and doses should not be increased earlier than 14 days." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for piroxicam and CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311963
Text: "In patients who are known or suspected to be poor CYP2C9 metabolizers based on genotype or previous history/experience with other CYP2C9 substrates (such as warfarin and phenytoin) consider dose reduction as they may have abnormally high plasma levels due to reduced metabolic clearance." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for piroxicam and CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311945
Text: "In patients who are known or suspected to be poor CYP2C9 metabolizers based on genotype or previous history/experience with other CYP2C9 substrates (such as warfarin and phenytoin) consider dose reduction as they may have abnormally high plasma levels due to reduced metabolic clearance." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for pitolisant and CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312397
Text: "In patients known to be poor CYP2D6 metabolizers, initiate WAKIX [pitolisant] at 8.9 mg once daily and titrate to a maximum dose of 17.8 mg once daily after 7 days." See label for more information

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for plazomicin and MT-RNR1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166341083
Text: The plazomicin label states: "Cases of ototoxicity with aminoglycosides have been observed in patients with certain variants in the mitochondrially encoded 12S rRNA gene (MT-RNR1), particularly the m.1555A>G variant. ... In case of known maternal history of ototoxicity due to aminoglycoside use or a known mitochondrial DNA variant in the patient, consider alternative treatments other than aminoglycosides unless the increased risk of permanent hearing loss is outweighed by the severity of infection and lack of safe and effective alternative therapies." See label for more information.
Lookup Key: MT-RNR1=increased risk of aminoglycoside-induced hearing loss

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for primaquine and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312222
Text: "Primaquine should not be prescribed for patients with severe G6PD deficiency." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for primaquine and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312223
Text: "In case of mild to moderate G6PD deficiency, a decision to prescribe primaquine must be based on an assessment of the risks and benefits..." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for primaquine and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166314961
Text: "In case of mild to moderate G6PD deficiency, a decision to prescribe primaquine must be based on an assessment of the risks and benefits..." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for rasburicase and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312326
Text: "Do not administer Elitek [rasburicase] to patients with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency...Elitek [rasburicase] is contraindicated in patients with G6PD deficiency..." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for sacituzumab govitecan and UGT1A1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166313101
Text: "Individuals who are homozygous for the uridine diphosphate-glucuronosyl transferase 1A1 (UGT1A1)*28 allele are at increased risk for neutropenia and may be at increased risk for other adverse reactions following initiation of TRODELVY [sacituzumab govitecan] treatment...Closely monitor patients with reduced UGT1A1 activity for severe neutropenia. The appropriate dose for patients who are homozygous for UGT1A1*28 is not known and should be considered based on individual patient tolerance to treatment." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for sevoflurane and CACNA1S, RYR1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312621
Text: "CONTRAINDICATIONS: Known or suspected genetic susceptibility to malignant hyperthermia...ULTANE [sevoflurane] can induce malignant hyperthermia in patients with known or suspected susceptibility based on genetic factors or family history, including those with certain inherited ryanodine receptor (RYR1) or dihydropyridine receptor (CACNA1S) variants." Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for siponimod and CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312707
Text: The MAYZENT (siponimod) label states: "Initiate MAYZENT with a 4-day titration, as shown in Table 2... Do not use the starter pack for patients who will be titrated to the 1-mg maintenance dosage." "In patients with a CYP2C9 *1/*3 or *2/*3 genotype, after treatment titration (see Treatment Initiation), the recommended maintenance dosage of MAYZENT is 1 mg taken orally once daily starting on Day 5." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for siponimod and CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312709
Text: The MAYZENT (siponimod) label states: "Recommended Dosage in Patients With CYP2C9 Genotypes *1/*1, *1/*2, or *2/*2" "Initiate MAYZENT with a 5-day titration, as shown in Table 1... A starter pack should be used for patients who will be titrated to the 2-mg maintenance dosage" "After treatment titration (see Treatment Initiation), the recommended maintenance dosage of MAYZENT is 2 mg taken orally once daily starting on Day 6." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for sodium nitrite and CYB5R3, G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312398
Text: "Because patients with G6PD deficiency are at increased risk of a hemolytic crisis with sodium nitrite administration, alternative therapeutic approaches should be considered in these patients." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for succinylcholine and BCHE, CACNA1S, RYR1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311921
Text: "ANECTINE [succinylcholine] is contraindicated in patients with...[k]nown or suspected genetic susceptibility to malignant hyperthermia...Anectine [succinylcholine] can induce malignant hyperthermia in patients with known or suspected susceptibility based on genetic factors or family history, including those with certain inherited ryanodine receptor (RYR1) or dihydropyridine receptor (CACNA1S) variants." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for succinylcholine and BCHE, CACNA1S, RYR1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312606
Text: "ANECTINE [succinylcholine] is contraindicated in patients with...[k]nown or suspected genetic susceptibility to malignant hyperthermia...Anectine [succinylcholine] can induce malignant hyperthermia in patients with known or suspected susceptibility based on genetic factors or family history, including those with certain inherited ryanodine receptor (RYR1) or dihydropyridine receptor (CACNA1S) variants...Succinylcholine is metabolized by plasma cholinesterase and should be used with caution, if at all, in patients known to be or suspected of being homozygous for the atypical plasma cholinesterase gene [BCHE] ." Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for sulfasalazine and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312421
Text: "Patients with glucose-6 phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency should be observed closely for signs of hemolytic anemia. This reaction is frequently dose related. If toxic or hypersensitivity reactions occur, the drug should be discontinued immediately." See label for more information.

Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166315121
Text: "Patients with glucose-6 phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency should be observed closely for signs of hemolytic anemia. This reaction is frequently dose related. If toxic or hypersensitivity reactions occur, the drug should be discontinued immediately." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for tafenoquine and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166315081
Text: "ARAKODA [tafenoquine] is contraindicated in: patients with G6PD deficiency or unknown G6PD status due to the risk of hemolytic anemia...[and] breastfeeding by a lactating woman when the infant is found to be G6PD deficient or if the G6PD status of the infant is unknown..." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for tafenoquine and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312291

Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312292

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for tamsulosin and CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312261
Text: "FLOMAX [tamsulosin] capsules should be used with caution... in patients known to be CYP2D6 poor metabolizers particularly at a dose higher than 0.4 mg (e.g., 0.8 mg)." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for tetrabenazine and CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166309041
Text: "In [CYP2D6] PMs, the initial dose and titration is similar to EMs except that the recommended maximum single dose is 25 mg, and the recommended daily dose should not exceed a maximum of 50 mg." See label for more information

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for tetrabenazine and CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166309043
Text: "Genotyped patients who are identified as extensive (EMs) or intermediate metabolizers (IMs) of CYP2D6, who need doses of XENAZINE [tetrabenazine] above 50 mg per day, should be titrated up slowly at weekly intervals by 12.5 mg daily, to allow the identification of a tolerated dose that reduces chorea. Doses above 50 mg per day should be given in a three times a day regimen. The maximum recommended daily dose is 100 mg and the maximum recommended single dose is 37.5 mg. If adverse reactions such as akathisia, parkinsonism, depression, insomnia, anxiety or sedation occur, titration should be stopped and the dose should be reduced. If the adverse reaction does not resolve, consideration should be given to withdrawing XENAZINE [tetrabenazine] treatment or initiating other specific treatment." See label for more information

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for thioguanine and NUDT15, TPMT
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312147
Text: "Most patients with heterozygous TPMT or NUDT15 deficiency tolerate recommended thioguanine doses, but some require dose reduction based on toxicities...Reduce the dosage based on tolerability." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for thioguanine and NUDT15, TPMT
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312134
Text: "Most patients with heterozygous TPMT or NUDT15 deficiency tolerate recommended thioguanine doses, but some require dose reduction based on toxicities. Patients who are heterozygous for both TPMT and NUDT15 may require more substantial dosage reductions. Reduce the dosage based on tolerability." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for thioguanine and NUDT15, TPMT
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312136
Text: "Most patients with heterozygous TPMT or NUDT15 deficiency tolerate recommended thioguanine doses, but some require dose reduction based on toxicities...Reduce the dosage based on tolerability." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for thioguanine and NUDT15, TPMT
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312123
Text: "Patients with homozygous deficiency of either TPMT or NUDT15 enzyme typically require 10% or less of the standard thioguanine dosage. Reduce initial dosage in patients who are known to have homozygous TPMT or NUDT15 deficiency." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for tobramycin and MT-RNR1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166341101
Text: The tobramycin label states: "Cases of ototoxicity with aminoglycosides have been observed in patients with certain variants in the mitochondrially encoded 12S rRNA gene (MT-RNR1), particularly the m.1555A>G variant. ... In case of known maternal history of ototoxicity due to aminoglycoside use or a known mitochondrial DNA variant in the patient, consider alternative treatments other than aminoglycosides unless the increased risk of permanent hearing loss is outweighed by the severity of infection and lack of safe and effective alternative therapies." See label for more information.
Lookup Key: MT-RNR1=increased risk of aminoglycoside-induced hearing loss

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for tolazamide and G6PD
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312341
Text: "Because tolazamide belongs to the class of sulfonylurea agents, caution should be used in patients with G6PD deficiency and a non-sulfonylurea alternative should be considered." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for valbenazine and CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312290
Text: "The recommended dosage for known CYP2D6 poor metabolizers is INGREZZA [valbenazine] 40 mg once daily." See label for more information

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for vortioxetine and CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166309461
Text: "The maximum recommended dose of TRINTELLIX [vortioxetine] is 10 mg/day in known CYP2D6 poor metabolizers." See label for more information.

Guideline Name: Annotation of FDA Label for warfarin and CYP2C9, PROC, PROS1, VKORC1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166324232
Text: Table 1 in the drug label provides ranges of expected maintenance daily doses of warfarin (COUMADIN) based on CYP2C9*2, CYP2C9*3 and VKORC1−1639G>A (rs9923231) genotypes. For CYP2C9*2/*3, VKORC1 AA (rs9923231 TT), the range of expected maintenance daily dose is 0.5-2 mg.

Text: Table 1 in the drug label provides ranges of expected maintenance daily doses of warfarin (COUMADIN) based on CYP2C9*2, CYP2C9*3 and VKORC1−1639G>A (rs9923231) genotypes. For CYP2C9*3/*3, VKORC1 AA (rs9923231 TT), the range of expected maintenance daily dose is 0.5-2 mg.

Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations and may have higher adverse reaction risk (heart failure). Dosage is based on individual response. The dose titration and monitoring schedule accounts for differences due to CYP2C19 genetic variation, so adjustments based on CYP2C19 genotype are not necessary. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations and monitoring."

Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166310802
Text: "Results in higher adverse reaction risk (severe skin reactions). Patients positive for HLA-B*15:02 may be at increased risk of severe skin reactions with other drugs that are associated with a risk of Stevens Johnson Syndrome/Toxic Epidermal necrolysis (SJS/TEN). Genotyping is not a substitute for clinical vigilance."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Azathioprine - TPMT and/or NUDT15
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166310894
Text: "Alters systemic active metabolite concentration and dosage requirements. Results in higher adverse reaction risk (myelosuppression). Consider alternative therapy in poor metabolizers. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Eliglustat - CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312389
Text: "Alters systemic concentrations, effectiveness, and adverse reaction risk (QT prolongation). Indicated for normal, intermediate, and poor metabolizer patients. Ultrarapid metabolizers may not achieve adequate concentrations to achieve a therapeutic effect. The recommended dosages are based on CYP2D6 metabolizer status. Coadministration with strong CYP3A inhibitors is contraindicated in intermediate and poor CYP2D6 metabolizers. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Fosphenytoin - CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166324225
Text: "May result in higher systemic concentrations and higher adverse reaction risk (central nervous system toxicity). Consider starting at the lower end of the dosage range and monitor serum concentrations. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations. Carriers of CYP2C9*3 alleles may be at increased risk of severe cutaneous adverse reactions. Consider avoiding fosphenytoin as an alternative to carbamazepine in patients who are CYP2C9*3 carriers. Genotyping is not a substitute for clinical vigilance and patient management."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Fosphenytoin - HLA-B
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166324221
Text: "May result in higher adverse reaction risk (severe cutaneous reactions). Patients positive for HLA-B*15:02 may be at increased risk of Stevens Johnson Syndrome/Toxic Epidermal necrolysis (SJS/TEN). Consider avoiding fosphenytoin as an alternative to carbamazepine in patients who are positive for HLA-B*15:02. Genotyping is not a substitute for clinical vigilance and patient management."

Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166310422
Text: "Results in higher systemic active metabolite concentrations and higher adverse reaction risk (severe or life-threatening neutropenia, severe diarrhea). Closely monitor for neutropenia during and after treatment. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Mercaptopurine - TPMT and/or NUDT15
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311029
Text: "Alters systemic active metabolite concentration and dosage requirements. Results in higher adverse reaction risk (myelosuppression). Initial dosages should be reduced in poor metabolizers; poor metabolizers generally tolerate 10% or less of the recommended dosage. Intermediate metabolizers may require dosage reductions based on tolerability. Intermediate metabolizers for both genes may require more substantial dosage reductions. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Mercaptopurine - TPMT and/or NUDT15
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311126
Text: "Alters systemic active metabolite concentration and dosage requirements. Results in higher adverse reaction risk (myelosuppression). Initial dosages should be reduced in poor metabolizers; poor metabolizers generally tolerate 10% or less of the recommended dosage. Intermediate metabolizers may require dosage reductions based on tolerability. Intermediate metabolizers for both genes may require more substantial dosage reductions. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Metoclopramide - CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312383
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations and higher adverse reaction risk. The recommended dosage is lower. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Nateglinide - CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166315222
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations and may result in higher adverse reaction risk (hypoglycemia). Dosage reduction is recommended. Increase monitoring frequency for adverse reactions. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Nateglinide - CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166315221
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations and may result in higher adverse reaction risk (hypoglycemia). Dosage reduction is recommended. Increase monitoring frequency for adverse reactions. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Oliceridine - CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312415
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations and higher adverse reaction risk (respiratory depression and sedation). May require less frequent dosing."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Pantoprazole - CYP2C19
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166310323
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Consider dosage reduction in children who are poor metabolizers. No dosage adjustment is needed for adult patients who are intermediate or poor metabolizers."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Pantoprazole - CYP2C19
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166310321
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Consider dosage reduction in children who are poor metabolizers. No dosage adjustment is needed for adult patients who are intermediate or poor metabolizers."

Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Consider dosage reduction in children who are poor metabolizers. No dosage adjustment is needed for adult patients who are intermediate or poor metabolizers."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Pantoprazole - CYP2C19
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166310322
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Consider dosage reduction in children who are poor metabolizers. No dosage adjustment is needed for adult patients who are intermediate or poor metabolizers."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Phenytoin - CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166324201
Text: "May result in higher systemic concentrations and higher adverse reaction risk (central nervous system toxicity). Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations. Carriers of CYP2C9*3 alleles may be at increased risk of severe cutaneous adverse reactions. Consider avoiding phenytoin as an alternative to carbamazepine in patients who are CYP2C9*3 carriers. Genotyping is not a substitute for clinical vigilance and patient management."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Phenytoin - HLA-B
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166324181
Text: "May result in higher adverse reaction risk (severe cutaneous reactions). Patients positive for HLA-B*15:02 may be at increased risk of Stevens Johnson Syndrome/Toxic Epidermal necrolysis (SJS/TEN). Consider avoiding phenytoin as an alternative to carbamazepine in patients who are positive for HLA-B*15:02. Genotyping is not a substitute for clinical vigilance and patient management."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Pimozide - CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312149
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Dosages should not exceed 0.05 mg/kg in children or 4 mg/day in adults who are poor metabolizers and dosages should not be increased earlier than 14 days."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Pimozide - CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312150
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Dosages should not exceed 0.05 mg/kg in children or 4 mg/day in adults who are poor metabolizers and dosages should not be increased earlier than 14 days."

Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311930
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Consider reducing dosage in poor metabolizers."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Piroxicam - CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311932
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Consider reducing dosage in poor metabolizers."

Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311944
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Consider reducing dosage in poor metabolizers."

Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311931
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Consider reducing dosage in poor metabolizers."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Pitolisant - CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312424
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Use lowest recommended starting dosage. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Propafenone - CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312181
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations and higher adverse reaction risk (arrhythmia). Avoid use in poor metabolizers taking a CYP3A4 inhibitor."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Sacituzumab Govitecan-hziy - UGT1A1
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166317861
Text: "May result in higher systemic concentrations and adverse reaction risk (neutropenia). Monitor for adverse reactions and tolerance to treatment."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Siponimod - CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312703
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Adjust dosage based on genotype. Do not use in patients with CYP2C9 *3/*3 genotype. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Siponimod - CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312705
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Adjust dosage based on genotype. Do not use in patients with CYP2C9 *3/*3 genotype. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312721
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Adjust dosage based on genotype. Do not use in patients with CYP2C9 *3/*3 genotype. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Siponimod - CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312704
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. Adjust dosage based on genotype. Do not use in patients with CYP2C9 *3/*3 genotype. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Tacrolimus - CYP3A5
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166315261
Text: "Results in lower systemic concentrations, lower probability of achieving target concentrations and may result in higher rejection risk. Measure drug concentrations and adjust dosage based on trough whole blood tacrolimus concentrations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Tacrolimus - CYP3A5
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166315263
Text: "Results in lower systemic concentrations, lower probability of achieving target concentrations and may result in higher rejection risk. Measure drug concentrations and adjust dosage based on trough whole blood tacrolimus concentrations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Tacrolimus - CYP3A5
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166315262
Text: "Results in lower systemic concentrations, lower probability of achieving target concentrations and may result in higher rejection risk. Measure drug concentrations and adjust dosage based on trough whole blood tacrolimus concentrations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Tetrabenazine - CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311407
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. The maximum recommended single dose is 25 mg and should not exceed 50 mg/day."

Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312044
Text: "Alters systemic active metabolite concentration and dosage requirements. Results in higher adverse reaction risk (myelosuppression). Initial dosages should be reduced in poor metabolizers; poor metabolizers generally tolerate 10% or less of the recommended dosage. Intermediate metabolizers may require dosage reductions based on tolerability. Intermediate metabolizers for both genes may require more substantial dosage reductions. Refer to FDA labeling for specific dosing recommendations."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Thioridazine - CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312402
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations and higher adverse reaction risk (QT prolongation). Predicted effect based on experience with CYP2D6 inhibitors. Contraindicated in poor metabolizers."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Tramadol - CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311223
Text: "Results in higher systemic and breast milk active metabolite concentrations, which may result in respiratory depression and death. Contraindicated in children under 12 and in adolescents following tonsillectomy/adenoidectomy. Breastfeeding is not recommended during treatment."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Venlafaxine - CYP2D6
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166315281
Text: "Alters systemic parent drug and metabolite concentrations. Consider dosage reductions."

Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166311321
Text: "Results in higher systemic concentrations. The maximum recommended dose is 10 mg."

Guideline Name: FDA PGx Association [Pharmacogenetic Associations for which the Data Support Therapeutic Management Recommendations]: Warfarin - CYP2C9
Name: Recommendation Annotation PA166312744
Text: "Alters systemic concentrations and dosage requirements. Select initial dosage, taking into account clinical and genetic factors. Monitor and adjust dosages based on INR."
